definition: Liao and Jin dynasties, namely: Liao or Khitan dynasty (907-1125) and Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
short name for Liaoning 遼寧|辽宁[Liao2 ning2] province/Liao or Khitan dynasty (907-1125)
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Galerkin's method is used to discrete the equations.
sentences.chinese: 利用伽辽金方法对动力学方程进行了离散。

sentences.english: Then the finite element formulae of this problem are obtained from Galerkin′s method.
sentences.chinese: 然后应用伽辽金法导出了这一问题的有限元计算公式。

sentences.english: The scaling functions are used as basis functions to construct the wavelet Galerkin finite element method.
sentences.chinese: 利用尺度函数作为基函数得到了小波伽辽金有限元法。

sentences.english: "Qiushan" deer vein was the silk pattern with northern features in the Jinliaoyuaan period.
sentences.chinese: “秋山”鹿纹是辽金元时期具有北方特色的丝绸纹样。

definition: Northern Dynasties (386-581)
Jin Dynasty (1115-1234), founded by the Jurchen 女真[Nu:3 zhen1] people of North China, a precursor of the Mongol Yuan Dynasty
Western Xia dynasty 1038-1227 of Tangut people 黨項|党项 occupying modern Ningxia and parts of Gansu and Shaanxi, overthrown by Mongols
Jin Dynasty (1115-1234), founded by the Jurchen 女真[Nu:3 zhen1] people of North China, a precursor of the Mongol Yuan Dynasty
Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
Wei of the Northern Dynasties (386-534), founded by the Tuoba 拓跋 branch of Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑
short name for Liaoning 遼寧|辽宁[Liao2 ning2] province/Liao or Khitan dynasty (907-1125)
Jurchen, a Tungus ethnic group, predecessor of the Manchu ethnic group who founded the Later Jin Dynasty 後金|后金[Hou4 Jin1] and Qing Dynasty
Goguryeo (37 BC-668 AD), one of the Korean Three Kingdoms
the Song dynasty (960-1279)/refers to the Northern (960-1127) and Southern Song (1128-1279)
Sui (581-617) and Tang dynasties (618-907)
Song dynasty (960-1279)/used to distinguish it from 劉宋|刘宋 Song of Southern dynasties (420-479)
History of the Liao Dynasty, twenty first of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed under Toktoghan 脫脫|脱脱[Tuo1 tuo1] in 1345 during the Yuan Dynasty 元[Yuan2], 116 scrolls
the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
Sixteen Kingdoms of Five non-Han people (ruling most of China 304-439)/also written 五胡十六國|五胡十六国
